properties.name: Alternatives
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc18 rue du Roi de Sicile, paris, france"Located near the Place des Vosges in the bohemian-chic Marais, Alternatives offers a tempting mix of well-priced designer ready-to-wear and lesser-known labels. In the designer category was an olive-green silk, knee-length Yohji Yamamoto skirt for £259, while a peach-coloured Martine Sitbon cotton blouse was £30. A sparkly but sporty Marc Jacobs blazer was £84; Louis Vuitton, Hermès, and Prada trousers cost from £54 and a staggeringly chic, knee-length black skirt with a four-inch flared panel around the hemline turned out to be Balenciaga - at £84. Dresses, coats, bags, shoes and men\'s clothing are also on offer."

Featuring DJ’s Dimitri and Johnny Omega on the decks blending beats from around the world and North America! The best of Top 40, Brazilian, Hip Hop and everything in between! Drink specials all night long including .25 Highballs! .75 Corona’s, Caipirinha’s and Caipiroska’s!! .25 Tequila shooters and .25 Mojito\'s! Bring two pieces of ID with you such as Passport, Drivers License, BCID,or any Government issued ID showing age.

properties.description: Posted by Silviatc15, rue Clément 75006 Paris"Coolin is one of the better-known Irish Pubs in Paris located in an ideal spot on the Saint Germain market place. It’s a pretty typical pub with a big wooden bar, a cold tobacco and beer smell and a good selection of British and Irish beers including of course Beamish, their speciality. The clientele is 80% Anglo-Saxon which means plenty of singing, dancing, shouting and the usual drunken behaviour you would find in a busy pub."

properties.description: Posted by Silviatc 19-33 ave. de Clichy, paris, france"It isn’t glamorous; it doesn’t sell designer cloths; it’s in a poor work-a-day neighborhood, and it’s one of the best known stores in Paris for used clothes (used with a capital U). There are piles upon piles and racks upon racks of used clothes spread out over several stores. You simply can’t beat the price."

properties.name: Gumshoe
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc40 South St., Jamaica Plain, maGeek chic! It’s still all the rage for indie guys, and if it’s your thing, nerdo, you’ll enjoy the cowboy shirts, old sports-tees and ceiling-high stack of cords and jeans here. It’s a little hard to get to, but they offer clothes that are even harder to get.

properties.name: Hadassah Bargain Spot
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc1123 Commonwealth Ave, boston, maI absolutely LOVE this place. The owner is soooooooo incredibly nice always joking and in a god mood and you can find some really good bargains. Plus you can donate any stuff you want. Don\'t pay any attention to what the actual prices are, if you buy more than two items, the owner (can\'t remember his name) just gives you a price, which is usually lower than the added totals.

properties.name: History
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc1693 Massachusetts Ave, cambridge, maWith racks of clothing organized by decade and loads of vintage t-shirts, History has clothing for everyone. Although most of the clothing is used (as implied by the name) there are some new clothes as well. The store is reasonably priced, well located and is run by a wonderful woman named Rachel who will answer any of your questions.

properties.name: Hôtel de Ville

properties.description: Posted by Silviatc 430 Amsterdam Avenue new york

properties.name: Jardin de Bagatelle
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc  Route de Sèvres à Neuilly 75016 Paris, France En été, 9h-20h sans interruption You see more shades of green than you ever thought possible. You find yourself stalking wild peacocks and making up zen riddles (why did the peacock cross the road … or … does a peacock strut even when no one is around?). And, if you’re there at the right time, you see rows of beauties competing in the annual rose competition, putting their best petals forward, each blossom trying to outdo the next. You can’t help but feel happy when the roses have names like Joyfulness, Stairway to Heaven, Salvation, Macho Man, Tequila Sunrise, and Pillow Fight. And even though most of the roses have been bred for beauty not fragrance, there are always a few well worth stopping to smell … reminding us of the real pleasures of life.

properties.name: Jeu de Paume

properties.description: Posted by Silviatc22 Rue du Roi de Sicile, Paris, France"In this dark shop selling vintage clothing and shoes and jeans from April 77 and Cheap Monday, it\'s easy to find something worth buying."

properties.name: Kiliwatch
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc84 rue Tiquetonne, paris, france"More pricey.. but a great place for vintage and new merchandise (located in the back of the store). More individualized items can be found such as jewelry, band t-shirts, and leather pumps."

properties.name: L'Assignat
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc7 rue Guénégaud, 75006"This is one of the friendliest and most animated bistros of the city... the brass bands that com here to practice from the Beaux-Art (Paris most famous art school) next door. They hold their rehearsals in the basement and regularly come up to the bar to perform. Usually there are ten or so musicians to about twenty drinkers who fill the bar with loud tuba, trumpet, drums and cymbal playing."

properties.name: La Pena
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc3 passage de la petite Boucherie , 75006"La Pena has become THE venue for lovers of Latin American culture over the past six years, with musicians and artists from South America passing through when they come to Paris. In true Latin spirit they know how to party and use the spacious basement for traditional music concerts once a week... the staff are warm and friendly and the clientele are laid back and always ready to party."

properties.name: Le Bon Marche
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc10 Arrow Street, Cambridge, MASome of the top picks for accessories here include 1920’s vintage style retro necklaces and unique evening bags. While some of the clothes here are a bit, ahem, “old ladyfish”, it’s a gold mine for lovers of interesting and tasteful accessories. If you search the clothes on the racks carefully, you might find a gorgeous vintage number.

properties.name: Le Jupon rouge
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc19 rue de Rochechouart, paris, france"The selection varies, but I’ve also found a MARNI 70ies inspired dress for 150 euroes."

properties.name: Le Misentroc
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc63 rue Notre-Dame des Champs, paris, france"Offers a good mixture of classically elegant fashions and trendier pieces. Black leather skirts were £45-£64; a romantic, whimsical white Lacroix dress was £118; a chocolate brown cotton eyelet blouse with a matching skirt, £78; a sleek Vivienne Westwood dress, £84; and Versace jeans, £30. While I tried on clothes, long-haired students and willowy actresses wandered in - regulars who love Misentroc for its eclectic shopping, hip location, and friendly atmosphere."

properties.name: Le Purgatoire
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc14 rue Hautefeuille, 75006"...only opens if men arrive in the company of a lady (or two). Once inside, it’s worth the bother as this large basement built of old stone with its bar and dance floor is friendly and fun. Drink brands hold regular promotional events here and it’s used for private hire for birthday parties or special events... It’s wise to arrive before 2am as the doors close and the party only continues for those already inside."

properties.name: Lolli by Reincarnation
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc 85 Stanton Street new york

properties.name: Maison Europeenne de la Photographie
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc  5-7, rue de Fourcy, Paris, France 75004 This museum, located in a restored 1706 mansion, features classical architecture in its façade, ironwork, and impressive central staircase. Original period prints, retrospective exhibits, and more than 12,000 rare books number among the attractions. There\'s also a conservation and restoration area, as well as a café in the 18th-century basement.

properties.name: Maison de FanFan
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc4, Rue Mayet, paris, france"FanFan is a small secondhand shop across the street from Tea and Tattered Pages, the English-language bookstore. Here they sell Hermes, Chanel, Vuitton, Dior, and used items from other designers. The shop is homey, and the folks here are friendlier than most."

properties.description: Posted by Silviatc88 Pleasant St, Malden, MAtwo stores off the orange line. They pay cash! Why donate. Their jewelry section is the best in the world, real or fake. kinda ghetto.

properties.name: Musée Bourdelle
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc 18, rue Antoine Bourdelle 75015 ParisThe museum preserves the studio of sculptor Antoine Bourdelle (1861-1929), a notable student of Auguste Rodin, and provides an example of Parisian ateliers from the late 19th and early 20th centuries. du mardi au dimanche de 10h à 18h -tarif jeune (14-26 ans): 3.50euros

properties.name: Musée d'Art Moderne de la Ville de Paris
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc 11, av du Président Wilson, Paris, France 75016Bridget Riley- abstract art This museum carries a large collection of avant-garde art from the 20th century, including works by Picasso, Léger, Matisse, and Kandinsky. Also on-hand is Raoul Dufy\'s large-scale tribute to electricity, "La Fée Electricité" ("Fairy of Electricity"). Surrealism and abstract art, along with other contemporary styles, offers insight into the creativity that fueled modern art. METRO: léna or Alma-Marceau

The vintage stuff is pretty high quality, too. They also have other hard to find stuff for sale, such as graffiti markers, Montana paints, a good range of paint caps, skateboards and accessories, and graffiti art on canvas for sale. properties.description: Posted by Silviatc123 Rue de la Pompe, paris, france"Hands down the coolest secondhand store in Paris, Reciproque has everything from designer clothes and accessories to tableware, jewelry, paintings, and furniture. It\'s the largest luxury consignment shop in the city, with seven different boutique-sized sections, and the selection is well chosen. You will not find the clutter typical of many the depot ventes, as every shop is organized by designer, clothing type, and color. Every well-known designer from around the world is represented in their collection."

properties.name: Second Time Around
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc99 Charles St., boston, ma This is branch of Second Time Around has a different feel than the Newbury St. stores - just by not being on Newbury it\'s not as crowded (most of the time), which makes the laborious process of digging through consignment a little easier. They get some really great stuff, and the turnover is pretty quick - I\'d go away for the weekend and when I came back there would be piles of new clothes.

properties.name: Second Time Around (Boston)
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc176 Newbury Street, boston, maCan you say upscale? This boutique has the hottest of labels- Seven, Christian Dior, Chaiken, Diesel, Ferragamo and more. This isn’t the place to go if you’re looking for cheap, unique thrift store clothes- most of the items here still cost a good chunk of change. But here you can pay a lot of money for designer, instead of ridiculous money for designer.

properties.name: Second Time Around (Cambridge)
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc8 Eliot Street, cambridge, maCan you say upscale? This boutique has the hottest of labels- Seven, Christian Dior, Chaiken, Diesel, Ferragamo and more. This isn’t the place to go if you’re looking for cheap, unique thrift store clothes- most of the items here still cost a good chunk of change. But here you can pay a lot of money for designer, instead of ridiculous money for designer.

properties.name: Stock shops
properties.description: Posted by Silviatcrue d\'Alésia, Paris, France"You\'ll find zillions of "stock" shops roughly between the Alésia and Plaisance métro stops. Stock shops are France\'s answer to outlet stores: with a good eye, you can find last year\'s designer styles at greatly reduced prices."

properties.name: Studio 28
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc  10 Rue Tholozé, Paris. franceStudio 28 is a much-loved neighborhood spot from the 1920s—Luis Buñuel\'s surreal Golden Age premiered here in the 1930s. It\'s still an active movie house (and puts on art shows and theatrical events as well), and the interior is largely unchanged since its glory days

properties.name: Sunday Market @ Les Marchés Saint-Ouen
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc136 avenue Michelet, st ouen, france"For clothing: le marché Malik. For miscellany: le marché Vernaison." Also mentioned in: http://ellenscloset.blogspot.com/2007/03/me-wants-blue-pumps.html "Irma- On a rack outside the shop you may find the occasional Sixties dress for a bargain. Marché Vernaison, Stand 200, allée n°9" (http://paris-vintage.blogspot.com/)

properties.name: Tempolini
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc5 Rue Gérando, Paris, France"The cute lady who owns the store offers shirts, dresses, boots, pumps, vintage Nike and PanAm bags and vintage accessories such as earrings and necklaces. I found a short tweed vintage LaFayette jacket for 30 euroes, and a kitsch vintage Burberry shirt for 20 euros."

properties.name: The Closet
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc175 Newbury St., boston, maI really love this place..... whether I\'m selling or buying. It is a bit cramped and cluttered and you certainly have to search ...but if you have patience and a good eye...oh the -secret-fabulous-finds will you locate!

properties.name: The Finer Consigner
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc53 langley rd., newton, maThe people who work here are very aloof. The accessories are my favorite part- lots of Chanel, Balenciaga, Louis Vuitton...the works. GREAT FOR: bags, costume jewelry, shoes.

properties.name: The Louvre
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc  75001 Paris, FranceWhy fight the crowds at the Musée du Louvre during the day, when you can have it almost all to yourself at night and save money to boot? From 6pm-9:45pm, Wednesday to Friday, the museum drops its ticket price from 8.50 Euros to 6 Euros

properties.name: Urban Renewals
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc122 Brighton Ave., allston, maIf you don\'t like picking through racks and racks of clothing in a HUGE wherehouse style building, this place is not for you! BUT -- its Bostons cheap Vintage shopping at its BEST. Like an earlier review said -- its great for wacky, ugly and stupid costumes, but also great for real clothes!

properties.name: Village Voice Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc  6 rue princesse paris franceI lived in Paris for seven years, from 1988 to 1995. The Village Voice is far and away the best English bookstore in Paris. It doesn\'t have the biggest selection but it has the best, and it is in a great neighborhood. I visit it whenever I go back.

properties.name: Zia Clothing Outlet
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc91 Trapelo Rd, belmont, maZia is a cute little local shop that houses a decent collection of new and used women\'s separates. Everything seems pretty cheap, so while I\'ve never found anything I wanted, it\'s fun to browse. Best for accessories, sometimes for shoes. It\'s one of those shops that spans generations, clothing-wise, so you\'ll have to pick through the layers of age, but I mean that in a good way. Friendly service, never pushy.
